title: 109_hr3566
content: NO FEDERAL FUNDS FOR DRUGS USED TO TREAT ERECTILE OR SEXUAL DYSFUNCTION. No Federal funds may be used for drugs prescribed for treating erectile or sexual dysfunction under certain federal health care programs, including Medicare, Medicaid, and the social services block grant program. The curr_chunk discusses various health programs including the maternal and child health block grant program, the Public Health Service Act, Indian Health Service programs, Federal employees health benefits program, military health programs, and medical care provided under specific codes. The curr_chunk defines "Federal health care program" as per section 1128B(f)(1) of the Social Security Act, encompassing various medical services for specific groups like veterans, Peace Corps volunteers, and Federal prisoners. The curr_chunk introduces amendments to the Social Security Act regarding Medicare and Medicaid programs, specifically adding coverage for drugs prescribed for erectile or sexual dysfunction. The amendments to the Social Security Act include coverage for drugs prescribed for erectile or sexual dysfunction in Medicare, Medicaid, FEHBP, and the Military health program. The pharmacy benefit program, Veterans' health, and IHS programs are prohibited from using funds for drugs prescribed for erectile or sexual dysfunction. The section prohibits the use of funds for drugs prescribed for erectile or sexual dysfunction, and applies to drugs dispensed after the date of enactment of this Act.
